DOC.detailed_description: Postoperative pain often severe follow total knee arthroplasty . Spinal anesthesia common method total knee arthroplasty . Adding morphine local anesthetic inject intrathecally prolongs analgetic effect , may give usual opioid side effect . The Local Infiltration Analgesia ( LIA ) technique proven effective reduce postoperative pain total knee arthroplasty . In LIA technique long-acting local anesthetic ( ropivacaine ) , nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug ( ketorolac ) , epinephrine infiltrate intraoperatively via intraarticular catheter postoperatively . The aim study evaluate spinal anesthesia together LIA technique provide well postoperative pain relief mobilization spinal anesthesia addition morphine local anesthetic intrathecally . Primary end-point morphine consumption first 48 postoperative hour . Secondary end-points pain intensity , knee function , time home readiness , hospital stay , side effect patient satisfaction . Patients follow 3 month surgery .
